isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - HARD START / NO START DIAGNOSTICS - Injection Control Pressure Test

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine injection control pressure during engine cranking.

note.para: Two procedures can be used if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is unavailable or fails to function. Low battery voltage or electronic failures will inhibit the EST from receiving diagnostic data.

svcsubproc.title: Measuring Injection Control Pressure Using a Breakout Tee

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

step1.para: Remove engine harness connector at ICP sensor.
Connect the ICP breakout tee between the engine harness connector and the ICP sensor.
Connect Digital Volt Ohm Meter (DMM) leads (+ Red, - Black) to the breakout tee (+ Green, - Black) as shown above.
Crank engine and check DMM voltage reading. Record reading on Mechanical Diagnostic form EGED-180-2.
If voltage is low, recheck oil level in reservoir (at EOT sensor) for correct oil level required to operate the fuel injectors.
If oil level is correct, go to Low ICP Pressure Test (Test 13).

svcsubproc.title: Measuring Injection Control Pressure Using a Breakout Box

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

step1.para: Remove upper engine harness (60 pin connector) from the ECM.
Install breakout box (ZTSE4445) adapter connector to the engine connector on the ECM. Connect engine harness connector to the breakout box connector.

note.para: Torque connector to ECM to 35 in·lbs (4 N·m).

step1.para: Connect the positive lead of the DMM to terminal 16 and the negative lead to terminal 19 .
Crank the engine and check DMM.
Record the injection control pressure voltage signal on Mechanical Diagnostics form EGED-180-2.

note.para: If Injection Control Pressure (ICP) is low, see Test 13 (Low ICP Pressure Test).

svcsubproc.title: Possible Causes
svcsubproc.para: Low injection control pressure (voltage) indicates the injectors are not receiving required oil pressure to operate the fuel injectors. Low injection control pressure can be caused by:

item.para: Oil reservoir leak down possibly through the check valve for the high pressure pump.
Pump drive gear loose or damaged
See Injection Pressure Regulator (IPR) diagnostics in Section 3, Electronic Control System Diagnostics.
